input_args.passage: 'David Wells | David Wells, On May 17, 1998, David Wells of the New York Yankees pitched the 15th perfect game in Major League Baseball history and the second in team history. Pitching against the Minnesota Twins at Yankee Stadium in The Bronx in front of 49,820 fans in attendance, Wells retired all 27 batters he faced., David Wells'
input_args.claim: "Given that David Wells pitched a perfect game against the Minnesota Twins in 1998, and considering the context and question, it can be inferred that David Wells had a perfect game against Paul Molitor's team."
